Head: Sad; aching, worse from motion
Brain seems swished hither and thither
Coryza, with burning or biting in nostrils
Noise in ears, as of cannon
Yellow face
Orbital right neuralgia, with profuse lachrymation
TOOTHACHE, RELIEVED BY GENERAL WARM SWEAT  Toothache extends to ear, temple, and cheek-bone
Fever: Shuddering all over; burning in palms; hot sweat in bed
Stomach: No appetite for meat and bread
Colic with much rumbling and ineffectual urging to stool
Diarrhoea in morning, with painful urging and burning in anus, and pressure in rectum and bladder
Back: Severe pains in region of LOWER INNER ANGLE OF LEFT SHOULDER-BLADE, running into chest

name: Chenopodi glauci aphis
details: Partakes largely of the properties of the plant upon which the insect lives.
